Row.Text: Pre-gunpowder melee units heal after destroying an enemy unit. Capturing enemy cities increases the population in the capital, and each time a city increases population you gain points towards a Great General.

Greetings to you, Suika Ibuki, mightiest of the oni of Gensokyo![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Long ago, the oni loved to drink, feast, and compete amongst themselves in various kinds of contests, from simple physical fighting to drinking games. However, when an oni found a human that they particularly liked, they tempted that human into challenging them in any way the human desired. Those times that the the human lost, they were abducted. Because normal humans were nowhere near an oni's level of ability, the humans began to resort to sneaky and underhanded tactics in order to beat the oni. Tired of being tricked and killed all the time, the oni eventually swore off humans forever and left for a place beyond human reach -- or so the legends say.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You, however, chose to remain behind. As time passed, though, you became lonely, and finally decided to try and lure the remaining oni out of hiding by holding feast after feast. Although your efforts ultimately failed, the appearance of other oni upon the surface suggests that they may yet return to rejoin the other youkai of Gensokyo.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Mighty and drunken Suika, will you find a way to re-establish the presence of the oni within Gensokyo?[NEWLINE]Can you gather a civilization that will stand the test of time?

Each source of [ICON_RES_WHEAT] Wheat, [ICON_RES_BANANA] Bananas, [ICON_RES_DEER] Deer, [ICON_RES_CITRUS] Citrus, [ICON_RES_WINE] Wine and [ICON_RES_SUGAR] Sugar worked by this City produce +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food. These bonuses double during Golden Ages. Melee and recon units trained in a city with a Brewery receive a unique Drunken Master promotion.

The Brewery is the Oni unique building, replacing the Granary. It provides increased food supply, even moreso than the standard Granary, and these bonuses are doubled during Golden Ages. Units trained in a city with a Brewery receive the Drunken Master promotion, which increases a unit's movement and defense.

Alcohol plays a central role in oni society, arguably moreso than the other residents of Gensokyo, as hardly any oni will be found without some form of alcohol nearby. Their talent for brewing is such that there are instances of oni alcohol having medicinal and regenerative properties, although these same brews have been said to cause humans to behave like oni, or even transform those who drink them into oni. The ready availability of alcohol and near-constant inebriation also causes the oni to be that much more belligerent and eager to challenge others, causing trouble for their neighbors.
During golden ages, the Brewery's output is doubled.

Alcohol plays a central role in oni society, arguably moreso than the other residents of Gensokyo, as hardly any oni will be found without some form of alcohol nearby. Their talent for brewing is such that there are instances of oni alcohol having medicinal and regenerative properties, although these same brews have been said to cause humans to behave like oni, or even transform those who drink them into oni. The ready availability of alcohol and near-constant inebriation also causes the oni to be that much more belligerent and eager to challenge others, causing trouble for their neighbors.
Provides 4 [ICON_RES_ONI_SAKE] Oni Sake for the Sake Bug decision.

Alcohol plays a central role in oni society, arguably moreso than the other residents of Gensokyo, as hardly any oni will be found without some form of alcohol nearby. Their talent for brewing is such that there are instances of oni alcohol having medicinal and regenerative properties, although these same brews have been said to cause humans to behave like oni, or even transform those who drink them into oni. The ready availability of alcohol and near-constant inebriation also causes the oni to be that much more belligerent and eager to challenge others, causing trouble for their neighbors.
Provides +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] for the Drinking Party decision.

Alcohol plays a central role in oni society, arguably moreso than the other residents of Gensokyo, as hardly any oni will be found without some form of alcohol nearby. Their talent for brewing is such that there are instances of oni alcohol having medicinal and regenerative properties, although these same brews have been said to cause humans to behave like oni, or even transform those who drink them into oni. The ready availability of alcohol and near-constant inebriation also causes the oni to be that much more belligerent and eager to challenge others, causing trouble for their neighbors.

Even amongst the oni there are those who are more powerful (and arguably more cruel), ending up in positions leading lesser oni. These are the kishin. They are most commonly found within Hell, leading groups of lesser oni in the torment of evil souls.

The Kishin is a unique Great Person for the Oni, replacing the Great General. It provides the same combat bonuses to nearby units, but also heals friendly units by 20HP each turn, as well as weakening the fighting strength of enemy units nearby. Unlike the Great General, the Kishin cannot construct a Citadel, but can start a Golden Age instead.
Great General unit. Only the Oni may produce them. Terrifies enemy units within 2 tiles and heals friendly units in the same tile or adjacent tiles.

Sometimes, a hermit or celestial will live for a period of time deemed too long by those responsible for overseeing the cycle of life and reincarnation. In these instances, a powerful kishin chief will be sent to assassinate them, so that they can receive their proper judgement.

The Kishin is a unique unit for the Oni. It only appears from the 'Kishin Chief' event. While it has many of the same effects as a regular Kishin, it is a combat unit instead of a Great Person, allowing it to attack and defend. Its combat strength increases depending on the era.
Unique unit. Only available through the 'Kishin Chief' event. Provides similar bonuses to the Kishin, while also functioning as a combat unit. Its strength increases depending on the era.

Considered by some to be the most powerful youkai in Gensokyo, Suika is currently the only oni known to have remained upon the surface when the rest of her kind retreated underground. As with most oni, she values strength and fair play while despising dishonesty and cowardice, but being slightly less honest than most oni, as well as unwilling to kidnap humans, she is also something of an outcast amongst her kind. Fortunately, this also helps her fit into the modern Gensokyo better than most of the other oni.
Hello there! I'm Suika, strongest of the oni! Care for a drink?
Well, well, so you've found me. I'm Suika, one of the Four Devas of the Mountain! Think you're strong enough to take us on?
Hey there! I'm Suika of the oni, and we should have a feast to celebrate this meeting!
Ahhh, someone to share a drink with! I'm Suika, the strongest drinker amongst the oni! We'll drink until you pass out!
Time to see just how strong you are!
I challenge you to a fight!
Things are getting a little boring, so it's time you and I had a fight!
Heh... I'm impressed! Someone as strong as an oni... perhaps some day, we'll fight again!
Ahhh... that was a good fight. Now, it's time for drinking!
I guess it wasn't time for the oni to return just yet... but someday, we will be back!
Heh, yeah, not the right time for a good fight.
Mmm, probably more fun to have another feast anyways.
Humans and youkai aren't strong enough to challenge an oni!
Weakling. Don't think you can match the strength of an oni!
Well, well, you're actually pretty strong! Let's share a drink instead.
Never thought I'd meet someone this strong. I'm looking forwards to our next fight!
Oh, hello! Come back to drink with the oni again?
Come back if you ever want another drink!
Oh, c'mon, you think I'm going to settle for that?
Maybe if you offered a bit more...
Heh, no way. Nice try, though.
Mmm, you've got some nice stuff there. How about a trade?
How about we open our borders to each other? It'll make it easier to drink together!
Mind sharing a few things? We broke some of our stuff after the last feast.
Hey, if it isn't my favorite drinking companion!
Hey, toss in a bit more, and I'll share some extra sake with you, okay?
Hey, we're friends, right? Just a bit more.
Sorry, but that's just not good enough.
Oh, sure, we don't really need that.
We're friends and all, but I can't really just give stuff like that away.
Hey, would you be willing to trade? I thought you might like some of this...
Would you be willing to help us out? We'll have a feast in your honor!
Why are you here? You're interrupting my drinking time.
I suppose I can stomach that deal.
Like I'm going to accept that offer?
You insult me with that offer.
No. Accepting that offer would be a disgrace to an oni.
Fine, take it! But I won't forget this.
No. Do you really think I'm so weak that I'd just give it to you?
You'd better agree to this, if you know what's good for you.
So you think you can take on an oni? Bring it on!
At least you aren't shy about getting in a fight!
I was hoping for a good fight right around now! I hope you're strong enough for it!
